t: John 13
Jesus Washes His Disciples’ Feet
Before*p the Passover Festival, Jesus knew that his hour had come to depart from this world to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
Now*p when it was time for supper, the devil had already put it into the heart of Judas, Simon Iscariot’s son, to betray him.
Jesus knew that the Father had given everything into his hands, that he had come from God, and that he was going back to God.
So he got up from supper, laid aside his outer clothing, took a towel, and tied it around himself.
Next, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet and to dry them with the towel tied around him.
He*p came to Simon Peter, who asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
Jesus*p answered him, “What*r I’m*r doing*r you*r don’t*r realize*r now,*r but*r afterward*r you*r will*r understand.”*r
“You*p will never wash my feet,” Peter said. Jesus*p replied, “If*r I*r don’t*r wash*r you,*r you*r have*r no*r part*r with*r me.”*r
Simon*p Peter said to him, “Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.”

“One*rp who*r has*r bathed,”*r Jesus told him, “doesn’t*r need*r to*r wash*r anything*r except*r his*r feet,*r but*r he*r is*r completely*r clean.*r You*r are*r clean,*r but*r not*r all*r of*r you.”*r
For he knew who would betray him. This is why he said, “Not*r all*r of*r you*r are*r clean.”*r
The Meaning of Foot Washing
When*p Jesus had washed their feet and put on his outer clothing, he reclined again and said to them, “Do*r you*r know*r what*r I*r have*r done*r for*r you?*r
You*r call*r me*r Teacher*r and*r Lord -*r and*r you*r are*r speaking*r rightly,*r since*r that*r is*r what*r I*r am.*r
So*r if*r I,*r your*r Lord*r and*r Teacher,*r have*r washed*r your*r feet,*r you*r also*r ought*r to*r wash*r one*r another’s*r feet.*r
For*r I*r have*r given*r you*r an*r example,*r that*r you*r also*r should*r do*r just*r as*r I*r have*r done*r for*r you.*r
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r a*r servant*r is*r not*r greater*r than*r his*r master,*r and*r a*r messenger*r is*r not*r greater*r than*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r him.*r
If*r you*r know*r these*r things,*r you*r are*r blessed*r if*r you*r do*r them.*r

“I’m*rp not*r speaking*r about*r all*r of*r you;*r I*r know*r those*r I*r have*r chosen.*r But*r the*r Scripture*r must*r be*r fulfilled:*r The*ir one*ir who*ir eats*ir my*ir bread*ir has*ir raised*ir his*ir heel*ir against*ir me.*ir
I*r am*r telling*r you*r now*r before*r it*r happens,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r does*r happen*r you*r will*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r he.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whoever*r receives*r anyone*r I*r send*r receives*r me,*r and*r the*r one*r who*r receives*r me*r receives*r him*r who*r sent*r me.”*r
Judas’s Betrayal Predicted
When*p Jesus had said this, he was troubled in his spirit and testified, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r me.”*r
The*p disciples started looking at one another - uncertain which one he was speaking about.
One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved, was reclining close beside Jesus.
Simon Peter motioned to him to find out who it was he was talking about.
So he leaned back against Jesus and asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
Jesus*p replied, “He’s*r the*r one*r I*r give*r the*r piece*r of*r bread*r to*r after*r I*r have*r dipped*r it.”*r When he had dipped the bread, he gave it to Judas, Simon Iscariot’s son.
After Judas ate the piece of bread, Satan entered him. So Jesus told him, “What*r you’re*r doing,*r do*r quickly.”*r
None*p of those reclining at the table knew why he said this to him.
Since Judas kept the money-bag, some thought that Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the festival,” or that he should give something to the poor.
After receiving the piece of bread, he immediately left. And it was night.
The New Command
When*p he had left, Jesus said, “Now*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r glorified,*r and*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r him.*r
If*r God*r is*r glorified*r in*r him,*r God*r will*r also*r glorify*r him*r in*r himself*r and*r will*r glorify*r him*r at*r once.*r

Little*r children,*r I*r am*r with*r you*r a*r little*r while*r longer.*r You*r will*r look*r for*r me,*r and*r just*r as*r I*r told*r the*r Jews,*r so*r now*r I*r tell*r you,*r ‘Where*r I*r am*r going,*r you*r cannot*r come.’*r
“I*rp give*r you*r a*r new*r command:*r Love*r one*r another.*r Just*r as*r I*r have*r loved*r you,*r you*r are*r also*r to*r love*r one*r another.*r
By*r this*r everyone*r will*r know*r that*r you*r are*r my*r disciples,*r if*r you*r love*r one*r another.”*r
Peter’s Denials Predicted
“Lord,”*p Simon Peter said to him, “where are you going?” Jesus*p answered, “Where*r I*r am*r going*r you*r cannot*r follow*r me*r now,*r but*r you*r will*r follow*r later.”*r
“Lord,”*p Peter asked, “why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”
Jesus*p replied, “Will*r you*r lay*r down*r your*r life*r for*r me?*r Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r a*r rooster*r will*r not*r crow*r until*r you*r have*r denied*r me*r three*r times.*r
